document.discussion_title: Envestnet Inc (NYSE:ENV) Given Consensus Rating of “Buy” by Brokerages
document.topic_text: Tweet Shares of Envestnet Inc (NYSE:ENV) have been assigned an average recommendation of “Buy” from the twelve ratings firms that are currently covering the company, MarketBeat.Com reports . Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold recommendation and six have assigned a buy recommendation to the company. The average 12 month price objective among brokers that have issued a report on the stock in the last year is $40.71. Other institutional investors recently bought and sold shares of the company. Russell Frank Co raised its position in Envestnet by 28.1% in the fourth quarter. Russell Frank Co now owns 259,668 shares of the company’s stock worth $7,758,000 after buying an additional 56,902 shares in the last quarter. Essex Investment Management Co. LLC raised its position in Envestnet by 40.6% in the fourth quarter. Essex Investment Management Co. LLC now owns 57,755 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,724,000 after buying an additional 16,670 shares in the last quarter. Summit Creek Advisors raised its position in Envestnet by 53.6% in the fourth quarter. Summit Creek Advisors now owns 392,021 shares of the company’s stock worth $11,702,000 after buying an additional 136,742 shares in the last quarter. Capital Impact Advisors raised its position in Envestnet by 234.7% in the fourth quarter. Capital Impact Advisors now owns 19,395 shares of the company’s stock worth $579,000 after buying an additional 13,600 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Janus Capital Management raised its position in Envestnet by 58.8% in the third quarter. Janus Capital Management now owns 2,689,305 shares of the company’s stock worth $80,598,000 after buying an additional 995,289 shares in the last quarter. Envestnet ( NYSE:ENV ) traded down 1.54% on Monday, hitting $30.75. 103,313 shares of the stock were exchanged. The company’s 50 day moving average is $26.87 and its 200 day moving average is $27.39. Envestnet has a 1-year low of $19.30 and a 1-year high of $55.23. The stock has a market cap of $1.20 billion and a PE ratio of 256.25. Envestnet (NYSE:ENV) last released its earnings results on Thursday, February 25th. The company reported $0.28 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.23 by $0.05. The business earned $118.60 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $115.94 million. The business’s revenue was up 22.5% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the prior year, the firm earned $0.23 EPS. On average, equities research analysts expect that Envestnet will post $0.98 earnings per share for the current year. ENV has been the topic of a number of recent analyst reports. JMP Securities decreased their target price on Envestnet from $60.00 to $36.00 in a research report on Monday, February 29th. Stifel Nicolaus reiterated a “buy” rating and issued a $40.00 target price (down previously from $56.00) on shares of Envestnet in a research report on Friday, April 8th. Jefferies Group initiated coverage on Envestnet in a research report on Thursday, March 24th. They issued a “buy” rating and a $48.00 target price on the stock. Zacks Investment Research upgraded Envestnet from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Wednesday, December 30th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. decreased their target price on Envestnet from $60.00 to $36.00 and set a “market outperform” rating on the stock in a research report on Monday, February 29th. Envestnet, Inc ( NYSE:ENV ) provides wealth management software and services to financial advisors and institutions. The Company works with Independent Registered Investment Advisors and advisors associated with financial institutions. Receive News & Ratings for Envestnet Inc Envestnet Inc
